rationale: This species has a wide distribution, with no known major widespread threats. It is therefore listed as Least Concern. It has also been assessed regionally as Least Concern for western Africa. For central Africa it has been categorised as Data Deficient - Thysochromis ansorgii is known from the lower Cross River and swampy locations in the Calabar and Great Kwa drainages, and the Ogowe basin. Teugels et al. (1991) recorded the presence of two specimens from Lac Kobambi in the Kouilou-Niari system of Congo-Brazzaville. Examination of these specimens confirms their identification as Thysochromis, and preliminary analysis reveals no obvious differences with T. ansorgii. The presence of Thysochromis ansorgii in Congo-Brazzaville is a significant southerly range extension. More information is needed on the species distribution before an assessment can be made for central Africa.
evaluator: Snoeks, J., Tweddle, D., Getahun, A., Lalèyè, P., Paugy, D., Zaiss, R., Fishar, M.R.A & Brooks, E.
